slokas: अर्जुन उवाचमदनुग्रहाय परमं गुह्यमध्यात्मसंज्ञितम् ।यत्त्वयोक्तं वचस्तेन मोहोऽयं विगतो मम ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: "O Lord, by Your grace, You have revealed to me the supreme secret, known as the inner Self. By Your words, my delusion has been dispelled."

slokas: भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया ।त्वत्त: कमलपत्राक्ष माहात्म्यमपि चाव्ययम् ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: "I had heard from You in detail about the creation and dissolution of beings, and also about Your imperishable greatness, O lotus-eyed one."

slokas: एवमेतद्यथात्थ त्वमात्मानं परमेश्वर ।द्रष्टुमिच्छामि ते रूपमैश्वरं पुरुषोत्तम ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: "Thus, O Lord of the universe, I have understood You as You are. Now I wish to see Your divine form, O Supreme Person."

slokas: मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया द्रष्टुमिति प्रभो ।योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानमव्ययम् ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: "If You think it is possible for me to see Your form, O Lord, O master of Yoga, then please show me Your imperishable Self."

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचपश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रश: ।नानाविधानि दिव्यानि नानावर्णाकृतीनि च ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: The Lord said: "O Partha, behold My forms, hundreds and thousands, of diverse kinds, divine, and of many colors and shapes."

slokas: पश्यादित्यान्वसून्‍रुद्रानश्विनौ मरुतस्तथा ।बहून्यदृष्टपूर्वाणि पश्याश्चर्याणि भारत ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: "See the Adityas, the Vasus, the Rudras, the Ashwins, and the Maruts. And, O descendant of Bharata, see many other wondrous things that you have never seen before."

slokas: इहैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य सचराचरम् ।मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्च‍ान्यद्‍द्रष्टुमिच्छसि ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: "Behold this universe, O Gudakesha, all that moves and is immovable, existing in one place, in My body. And whatever else you wish to see, see it here."

slokas: न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा ।दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षु: पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: "You cannot see Me with these eyes of yours. I give you divine vision. Now see My divine Yoga."

slokas: सञ्जय उवाचएवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन्महायोगेश्वरो हरि: ।दर्शयामास पार्थाय परमं रूपमैश्वरम् ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: Sanjaya said: "After speaking thus, O King, the great Lord of Yoga, Hari, showed Arjuna His supreme, divine form."

slokas: अनेकवक्‍त्रनयनमनेकाद्भ‍ुतदर्शनम् ।अनेकदिव्याभरणं दिव्यानेकोद्यतायुधम् ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: “With countless mouths and eyes, with countless wondrous sights, adorned with countless divine ornaments, with countless raised weapons.”

slokas: दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरं दिव्यगन्धानुलेपनम् ।सर्वाश्चर्यमयं देवमनन्तं विश्वतोमुखम् ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: "Wearing divine garlands and garments, anointed with divine perfumes, a divine being, wondrous in every way, infinite and with faces everywhere.  "

slokas: दिवि सूर्यसहस्रस्य भवेद्युगपदुत्थिता ।यदि भा: सदृशी सा स्याद्भ‍ासस्तस्य महात्मन: ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: "If the radiance of a thousand suns were to rise all at once, it might resemble the glory of the great-souled One."

slokas: तत्रैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं प्रविभक्तमनेकधा ।अपश्यद्देवदेवस्य शरीरे पाण्डवस्तदा ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: "Then, in the body of that Lord of gods, the Pandava saw the entire universe divided into many parts, as if it were all in one place."

slokas: तत: स विस्मयाविष्टो हृष्टरोमा धनञ्जय: ।प्रणम्य शिरसा देवं कृताञ्जलिरभाषत ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: "Seeing this, Arjuna was filled with wonder, his hair stood on end, and, bowing his head in reverence, with folded hands, he spoke to the Lord."

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचपश्यामि देवांस्तव देव देहेसर्वांस्तथा भूतविशेषसङ्घान् ।ब्रह्माणमीशं कमलासनस्थ-मृषींश्च सर्वानुरगांश्च दिव्यान् ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: "O Lord, I see all the gods in Your body, and all the assemblies of different beings. I see Brahma, Shiva, and the sages seated on lotus thrones, and all the divine snakes."

slokas: अनेकबाहूदरवक्‍त्रनेत्रंपश्यामि त्वां सर्वतोऽनन्तरूपम् ।नान्तं न मध्यं न पुनस्तवादिंपश्यामि विश्वेश्वर विश्वरूप ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: "O Lord of the universe, I see you with many arms, bellies, mouths, and eyes, Your form is infinite, without beginning, middle, or end. I see you everywhere, O universal form!"

slokas: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रिणं चतेजोराशिं सर्वतो दीप्‍तिमन्तम् ।पश्यामि त्वां दुर्निरीक्ष्यं समन्ता-द्दीप्‍तानलार्कद्युतिमप्रमेयम् ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: “I see you adorned with a crown, wielding a mace and disk, dazzling with brilliance everywhere. I see you, inconceivable, blazing with the brilliance of a million suns, impossible to behold."

slokas: त्वमक्षरं परमं वेदितव्यंत्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् ।त्वमव्यय: शाश्वतधर्मगोप्‍तासनातनस्त्वं पुरुषो मतो मे ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: "You are the imperishable, the ultimate truth to be known. You are the supreme refuge of this universe. You are the imperishable, the eternal guardian of Dharma. You are the Supreme Person, as I understand You."

slokas: अनादिमध्यान्तमनन्तवीर्य-मनन्तबाहुं शशिसूर्यनेत्रम् ।पश्यामि त्वां दीप्‍तहुताशवक्‍त्रंस्वतेजसा विश्वमिदं तपन्तम् ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: “I see you, without beginning, middle, or end, with infinite energy, with infinite arms, with eyes like the sun and moon, your face blazing like a thousand suns, burning this universe with your own brilliance.”

slokas: द्यावापृथिव्योरिदमन्तरं हिव्याप्‍तं त्वयैकेन दिशश्च सर्वा: ।दृष्ट्वाद्‍भुतं रूपमुग्रं तवेदंलोकत्रयं प्रव्यथितं महात्मन् ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: “You fill this space between heaven and earth, and every direction. O great soul, seeing your wondrous, terrible form, these three worlds are trembling.”

slokas: अमी हि त्वां सुरसङ्घा विशन्तिकेचिद्भ‍ीता: प्राञ्जलयो गृणन्ति ।स्वस्तीत्युक्त्वा महर्षिसिद्धसङ्घा:स्तुवन्ति त्वां स्तुतिभि: पुष्कलाभि: ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: “Some of these gods, terrified, are entering your body, bowing and praising you. The great sages and Siddhas, saying, ‘Peace! Peace!’, are praising you with abundant hymns.”

slokas: रुद्रादित्या वसवो ये च साध्याविश्वेऽश्विनौ मरुतश्चोष्मपाश्च ।गन्धर्वयक्षासुरसिद्धसङ्घावीक्षन्ते त्वां विस्मिताश्चैव सर्वे ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: “The Rudras, Adityas, Vasus, Sadhyas, Vishvedevas, Ashwins, Maruts, Ushmapas, Gandharvas, Yakshas, Asuras, and Siddhas, all are astonished to see you.”

slokas: रूपं महत्ते बहुवक्‍त्रनेत्रंमहाबाहो बहुबाहूरुपादम् ।बहूदरं बहुदंष्ट्राकरालंदृष्ट्वा लोका: प्रव्यथितास्तथाहम् ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: “Seeing your great form, with many mouths, eyes, arms, legs, bellies, and terrible fangs, I, along with the rest of the world, am terrified.”

slokas: नभ:स्पृशं दीप्‍तमनेकवर्णंव्यात्ताननं दीप्‍तविशालनेत्रम् ।दृष्ट्वा हि त्वां प्रव्यथितान्तरात्माधृतिं न विन्दामि शमं च विष्णो ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: "O Vishnu, seeing your form, which touches the sky, is blazing with many colors, has a wide mouth, and has bright, large eyes, my heart is trembling, and I find no courage or composure."

slokas: दंष्ट्राकरालानि च ते मुखानिदृष्ट्वैव कालानलसन्निभानि ।दिशो न जाने न लभे च शर्मप्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_translated: "Seeing your terrible mouths, which resemble the fires of death,  I don't know the directions, I find no peace. Please be merciful, O Lord, O dweller in the universe."

slokas: अमी च त्वां धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्रा:सर्वे सहैवावनिपालसङ्घै: ।भीष्मो द्रोण: सूतपुत्रस्तथासौसहास्मदीयैरपि योधमुख्यै: ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_translated: "All the sons of Dhritarashtra, along with the armies of kings, and Bhishma, Drona, Karna, the son of a charioteer, and all the rest of our warriors, are entering your mighty mouth."

slokas: वक्‍त्राणि ते त्वरमाणा विशन्तिदंष्ट्राकरालानि भयानकानि ।केचिद्विलग्न‍ा दशनान्तरेषुसन्दृश्यन्ते चूर्णितैरुत्तमाङ्गै: ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_translated: "They are rushing into your mouths, which are terrible, with sharp fangs. Some are seen stuck between your teeth, with their limbs crushed."

slokas: यथा नदीनां बहवोऽम्बुवेगा:समुद्रमेवाभिमुखा द्रवन्ति ।तथा तवामी नरलोकवीराविशन्ति वक्‍त्राण्यभिविज्‍वलन्ति ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_translated: “Just as many rivers rush towards the ocean with their currents, so these heroes of the human world are rushing into your blazing mouths."

slokas: यथा प्रदीप्‍तं ज्‍वलनं पतङ्गाविशन्ति नाशाय समृद्धवेगा: ।तथैव नाशाय विशन्ति लोका-स्तवापि वक्‍त्राणि समृद्धवेगा: ॥ २९ ॥
slokas_translated: “Just as moths rush into a blazing fire for their destruction, even so these beings are rushing with great speed into your mouths for their destruction.”

slokas: लेलिह्यसे ग्रसमान: समन्ता-ल्ल‍ोकान्समग्रान्वदनैज्‍‍र्वलद्भ‍िः ।तेजोभिरापूर्य जगत्समग्रंभासस्तवोग्रा: प्रतपन्ति विष्णो ॥ ३० ॥
slokas_translated: “O Vishnu, you are licking up all beings with your blazing mouths. Your fierce radiance fills the entire universe.  And your effulgence is burning the whole world.”

slokas: आख्याहि मे को भवानुग्ररूपोनमोऽस्तु ते देववर प्रसीद ।विज्ञातुमिच्छामि भवन्तमाद्यंन हि प्रजानामि तव प्रवृत्तिम् ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas_translated: “Please tell me who You are, O awesome one.  I bow to You, O god, please be merciful. I want to know You, the primordial one. For I do not know the extent of your power."

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचकालोऽस्मि लोकक्षयकृत्प्रवृद्धोलोकान्समाहर्तुमिह प्रवृत्त: ।‍ऋतेऽपि त्वां न भविष्यन्ति सर्वेयेऽवस्थिता: प्रत्यनीकेषु योधा: ॥ ३२ ॥
slokas_translated: The Lord said: "I am Time, the destroyer of all things, come to annihilate these worlds.  Even without you, all the warriors standing in opposing armies would not survive."

slokas: तस्मात्त्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्वजित्वा शत्रून्भुंक्ष्व राज्यं समृद्धम् ।मयैवैते निहता: पूर्वमेवनिमित्तमात्रं भव सव्यसाचिन् ॥ ३३ ॥
slokas_translated: "Therefore, stand up and gain glory. Conquer your enemies and enjoy a prosperous kingdom. All these warriors have already been slain by Me. You are merely an instrument, O Savyasachi."

slokas: द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं चकर्णं तथान्यानपि योधवीरान् ।मया हतांस्त्वं जहि मा व्यथिष्ठायुध्यस्व जेतासि रणे सपत्‍नान् ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas_translated: “Drona, Bhishma, Jayadratha, Karna, and all the other mighty warriors, I have already slain them. Fight without fear, and you shall conquer your enemies in battle.”

slokas: सञ्जय उवाचएतच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं केशवस्यकृताञ्जलिर्वेपमान: किरीटी ।नमस्कृत्वा भूय एवाह कृष्णंसगद्ग‍दं भीतभीत: प्रणम्य ॥ ३५ ॥
slokas_translated: Sanjaya said: “Hearing these words of Keshava, Arjuna, crowned with a diadem,  bowed his head and, trembling, spoke to Krishna in a choked voice, bowing again and again.”

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचस्थाने हृषीकेश तव प्रकीर्त्याजगत्प्रहृष्यत्यनुरज्यते च ।रक्षांसि भीतानि दिशो द्रवन्तिसर्वे नमस्यन्ति च सिद्धसङ्घा: ॥ ३६ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: "O Hrishikesha, the world rejoices and is attracted by your fame. The demons are terrified, the directions tremble, and all the Siddhas bow down to you."

slokas: कस्माच्च‍ ते न नमेरन्महात्मन्गरीयसे ब्रह्मणोऽप्यादिकर्त्रे ।अनन्त देवेश जगन्निवासत्वमक्षरं सदसत्तत्परं यत् ॥ ३७ ॥
slokas_translated: “O great soul, why should not all beings bow down to you, who are greater than Brahma himself, the primeval creator? You are infinite, O Lord of the universe, the abode of all beings, the imperishable, and the ultimate reality beyond existence and non-existence.”

slokas: त्वमादिदेव: पुरुष: पुराण-स्त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् ।वेत्तासि वेद्यं च परं च धामत्वया ततं विश्वमनन्तरूप ॥ ३८ ॥
slokas_translated: “You are the primordial god, the original Person, the ancient one. You are the supreme refuge of this universe. You are the knower and the known, the supreme abode, and the universe is pervaded by You, who are infinite in form.”

slokas: वायुर्यमोऽग्न‍िर्वरुण: शशाङ्क:प्रजापतिस्त्वं प्रपितामहश्च ।नमो नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्रकृत्व:पुनश्च भूयोऽपि नमो नमस्ते ॥ ३९ ॥
slokas_translated: "You are the wind, Yama, fire, Varuna, the moon, Prajapati, and Brahma, the grandsire.  I bow to you a thousand times, and again and again, I bow to you."

slokas: नम: पुरस्तादथ पृष्ठतस्तेनमोऽस्तु ते सर्वत एव सर्व ।अनन्तवीर्यामितविक्रमस्त्वंसर्वं समाप्‍नोषि ततोऽसि सर्व: ॥ ४० ॥
slokas_translated: "I bow to you from the front, from the back, from all sides, and everywhere. You are infinite in power, with unyielding might. You are all, and you pervade all. Therefore, you are all."

slokas: सखेति मत्वा प्रसभं यदुक्तंहे कृष्ण हे यादव हे सखेति ।अजानता महिमानं तवेदंमया प्रमादात्प्रणयेन वापि ॥ ४१ ॥
slokas_translated: “Out of familiarity, I have spoken to you as, ‘O Krishna, O Yadava, O friend,’ out of ignorance of your greatness, or perhaps out of love.  “

slokas: यच्च‍ावहासार्थमसत्कृतोऽसिविहारशय्यासनभोजनेषु ।एकोऽथवाप्यच्युत तत्समक्षंतत्क्षामये त्वामहमप्रमेयम् ॥ ४२ ॥
slokas_translated: "And if I have treated you lightly, by speaking jestingly, or in matters of recreation, beds, seats, or food, or if I have at any time been disrespectful in your presence, O Achyuta, then forgive me, O immeasurable one."

slokas: पितासि लोकस्य चराचरस्यत्वमस्य पूज्यश्च गुरुर्गरीयान् ।न त्वत्समोऽस्त्यभ्यधिक: कुतोऽन्योलोकत्रयेऽप्यप्रतिमप्रभाव ॥ ४३ ॥
slokas_translated: "You are the father of the movable and immovable world.  You are the most venerable, the greatest teacher. There is no one equal to you, nor is there anyone more powerful in the three worlds."

slokas: तस्मात्प्रणम्य प्रणिधाय कायंप्रसादये त्वामहमीशमीड्यम् ।पितेव पुत्रस्य सखेव सख्यु:प्रिय: प्रियायार्हसि देव सोढुम् ॥ ४४ ॥
slokas_translated: “Therefore, I bow down to you, I offer myself to you, I appease you, the most worshipful Lord. Like a father to his son, a friend to his friend, a beloved to his beloved, O god, you are worthy of being endured. ”

slokas: अदृष्टपूर्वं हृषितोऽस्मि दृष्ट्वाभयेन च प्रव्यथितं मनो मे ।तदेव मे दर्शय देव रूपंप्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास ॥ ४५ ॥
slokas_translated: “Seeing your form, I am overcome with joy and fear, my mind is troubled. Please, O god, show me your form again.  Be merciful, O Lord of the universe.”

slokas: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्त-मिच्छामि त्वां द्रष्टुमहं तथैव ।तेनैव रूपेण चतुर्भुजेनसहस्रबाहो भव विश्वमूर्ते ॥ ४६ ॥
slokas_translated: "I wish to see you again, adorned with a crown, holding a mace and a disk, in that same four-armed form.  O universal form, O thousand-armed one, please appear in that form.”

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचमया प्रसन्नेन तवार्जुनेदंरूपं परं दर्शितमात्मयोगात् ।तेजोमयं विश्वमनन्तमाद्यंयन्मे त्वदन्येन न दृष्टपूर्वम् ॥ ४७ ॥
slokas_translated: The Lord said: “O Arjuna, because you are devoted, I have shown you this supreme form, emerging from My Yoga.  This radiant, infinite, primordial universe has never been seen before by anyone other than you."

slokas: न वेदयज्ञाध्ययनैर्न दानै-र्न च क्रियाभिर्न तपोभिरुग्रै: ।एवंरूप: शक्य अहं नृलोकेद्रष्टुं त्वदन्येन कुरुप्रवीर ॥ ४८ ॥
slokas_translated: “No one in this world, O best of the Kurus, can see Me in this form, not through the study of the Vedas, not by sacrifices, not by charity, not by austerities, not through any other action.”

slokas: मा ते व्यथा मा च विमूढभावोदृष्ट्वा रूपं घोरमीदृङ्‍ममेदम् ।व्यपेतभी: प्रीतमना: पुनस्त्वंतदेव मे रूपमिदं प्रपश्य ॥ ४९ ॥
slokas_translated: "Don’t be distressed, don’t be bewildered. Seeing this terrible form of Mine,  be fearless, be happy.  See Me again in this very form.”

slokas: सञ्जय उवाचइत्यर्जुनं वासुदेवस्तथोक्त्वास्वकं रूपं दर्शयामास भूय: ।आश्वासयामास च भीतमेनंभूत्वा पुन: सौम्यवपुर्महात्मा ॥ ५० ॥
slokas_translated: Sanjaya said: “Having said this to Arjuna, Vasudeva again showed him His own form.  And, resuming His gentle form, the great soul reassured Arjuna, who was frightened."

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचदृष्ट्वेदं मानुषं रूपं तव सौम्यं जनार्दन ।इदानीमस्मि संवृत्त: सचेता: प्रकृतिं गत: ॥ ५१ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: "Seeing your gentle human form, O Janardana, my mind is now composed and I have returned to my natural state."

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचसुदुर्दर्शमिदं रूपं दृष्टवानसि यन्मम ।देवा अप्यस्य रूपस्य नित्यं दर्शनकाङ्‍‍क्षिण: ॥ ५२ ॥
slokas_translated: The Lord said: "This form of Mine, which you have seen, is very difficult to see. Even the gods always desire to see this form.”

slokas: नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानेन न चेज्यया ।शक्य एवंविधो द्रष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा ॥ ५३ ॥
slokas_translated: "I cannot be seen by the Vedas, not by austerities, not by charity, not by sacrifices.  You have seen Me in this form as I am."

slokas: भक्त्य‍ा त्वनन्यया शक्य अहमेवंविधोऽर्जुन ।ज्ञातुं द्रष्टुं च तत्त्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परन्तप ॥ ५४ ॥
slokas_translated: “O Arjuna, O chastiser of the enemy, I can be known, seen in My true nature, and entered into only by unalloyed devotion.”

slokas: मत्कर्मकृन्मत्परमो मद्भ‍क्त: सङ्गवर्जित: ।निर्वैर: सर्वभूतेषु य: स मामेति पाण्डव ॥ ५५ ॥
slokas_translated: "He who performs actions for My sake, who is devoted to Me, who is free from attachment, who is without hatred towards all beings, he comes to Me, O Pandava."
